user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: The screen shows a "No results" message under the "Creations" section of an app. It suggests trying a synonym or more general words to find results. There's a simple illustration of a UFO beaming up objects in the center. The interface includes a back button and a menu option at the top. The screen indicates that a search or query returned no matches.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.
click on the back button "<-" located at the top-left.
click on the "Search your photos" bar located at the top.
click on the "Show more" text located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.
click on the "Creations" located at the upper middle left side of the screen.

think_action.Thought: The current screen shows a 'No results' message under the 'Creations' section of Google Photos, indicating that no creations were found for the query or search. Since the user is looking for saved creations, I need to either refine the search or navigate to a different section of the app to explore the saved creations.
Future Action Plan: Refine the search term to see if there are any results or try a different search term for creations.
Alternatively, navigate to a different section of the app, such as albums or photos, to check for creations.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Tap on the 'Search your photos' bar again to refine the search or try a different term.
